wicket.0: It’s in the air, AND IT’S CAUGHT!
wicket.1: Oh well bowled, that’s close HE’S GIVEN HIM.
wicket.2: There it is, they’ll go…this’ll be out, surely!! OHH HE’S OUT.
wicket.4: Open the book,turn to page 32. This is how you take a wicket.
wicket.5: Straight Down the Fielder's Throat! He's gone.
wicket.6: Right Up in the Blockhole and the batsman is bowled.
wicket.7: The keeper is so quick..beautiful stumping and the batsman has to walk.
wicket.8: It's miles in the air… it's a wonderful catch! What a catch! The greatest catch! Unbelievable
wicket.9: That was hit really hard… no it wasn't, he has just walked into the dressing room

1.0: 1 run, slides on middle and leg, he helps it away to deep square leg
1.1: 1 run, takes the pace off, angles into the body. He stays inside line and muscles it to deep square leg
1.2: 1 run, full outside off, chipped away to sweeper cover
1.3: 1 run, flat, short and outside off. He drills it to long-off
1.4: 1 run, pushes this to cover and gets off strike
1.5: 1 run, slanted on leg-stump, glanced away to fine leg
1.6: 1 run, pushes this length delivery to cover with soft hands
1.7: 1 run, on the stumps, knocked to mid-wicket

2.0: 2 runs, really could've had more had the connection been a bit better
2.1: 140.4kph, full, on middle, whipped wide of mid-on. +2
2.2: 2 runs, takes it off the back foot, with a very wristy slap through the covers.
2.3: 2 runs, serious miscue ., but landing right in between three converging fielders.
2.4: 2 runs, sinks to one knee and sweeps the full delivery to the right of fine leg.
2.5: 2 runs, makes room and drills the full delivery outside off in the gap to the right of extra cover.
2.6: 2 runs, low full toss, was the dipping slower delivery
2.7: oh he's played a forehand smash pull to this rising short delivery, in the gap at mid-wicket for two

3.0: 140.4kph, full, on middle, whipped wide of mid-on. +3
3.1: back of a length delivery across off, he goes for an ambitious drive on the up probably aiming for extra cover, 3 runs
3.2: Shorter, drags it away to the left of deep mid-wicket, beautiful running! +3
3.3: Fuller length delivery and well wide of off, he leans into the drive and carves it wide of cover, they're back for the third
3.4: back of a length and angling across the right-hander, chopped away in front of square on the off-side for 3 runs
3.5: You have to give it to them, amazing running, 3 runs!

5.0: Its an overthrow and its gone for four more..,+5
5.1: Total chaos and the ball reaches the boundary

6.0: Oh he’s hit this one miles, great shot OHHH IT’S A BIGGIE, straight over the to
6.1: That was a tremendous six. The ball was still in the air as it went over the boundary.
6.2: Thats six! When He Hits It, It Stays Hit!
6.3: Let me tell you, there are fielders on the ground by the way
6.4: Some of the sea gulls flying here are going to get a complex.
6.5: He's reverse-sweeped that again. There is this new disease in cricket called Reversesweepitis
6.6: 6s and 4s seems to be the new binary code for this man
6.7: That ball had 'Off to the boundary, see you later' written all over it
6.8: What a biggie! It's gone into the trees.

4.0: He’s smashed him down the ground, what a player…. WHAT A WONDERFUL PLAYER!!!
4.1: That's a Proper Cricket Shot, beautiful boundary.
4.2: He just loves to storm through. I guess if he had a car, he would probably start it in 4th gear.
4.3: Touch of class and stamp of authority!
4.4: He's reverse-sweeped that again. There is this new disease in cricket called Reversesweepitis
4.5: 6s and 4s seems to be the new binary code for this man
4.6: That ball had 'Off to the boundary, see you later' written all over it
4.7: He's blazed that one through the off-side field… go and fetch that!

win.0: GAME. SET. MATCH. The baton of the finisher was passed sometime back
win.1: Alas, it was too good to be true.
win.2: A comprehensive win. But let that not paper over the cracks of which there are plenty.
win.3: A thundering win! Anti-climax as we don't get the glory hit.
win.4: Nails the pull shot through midwicket this time to seal a comprehensive win.
win.5: Full toss outside off, driven through the covers for four and that's a win.
